io.o2mc.sdk

Class O2MC

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.o2mc.sdk.O2MC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks

    public class O2MC
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks
    This is central point of communication between the SDK and the app implementing it. The implementing app should never have anything to deal with any other class than this one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • O2MC

        public O2MC(android.app.Application app,
            java.lang.String endpoint)
        This is central point of communication between the SDK and the app implementing it. The implementing app should never have anything to deal with any other class than this one.
        Parameters:
        app - Top-level application class, as defined in the app manifest. Used to automatically detect meta-events like ActivityStarted and ActivityDestroyed.
        endpoint - URL to the back-end, defines where to dispatch tracking events to.

      • O2MC

        public O2MC(android.app.Application app,
            java.lang.String endpoint,
            int dispatchInterval)
        This is central point of communication between the SDK and the app implementing it. The implementing app should never have anything to deal with any other class than this one.
        Parameters:
        app - Top-level application class, as defined in the app manifest
        endpoint - URL to the back-end, defines where to dispatch tracking events to
        dispatchInterval - Tells the EventManager on which intervals it should send the generated events. Denoted in seconds.

      • O2MC

        public O2MC(android.app.Application app,
            java.lang.String endpoint,
            int dispatchInterval,
            int maxRetries)
        This is central point of communication between the SDK and the app implementing it. The implementing app should never have anything to deal with any other class than this one.
        Parameters:
        app - Top-level application class, as defined in the app manifest
        endpoint - URL to the back-end, defines where to dispatch tracking events to
        dispatchInterval - Tells the EventManager on which intervals it should send the generated events. Denoted in seconds.
        maxRetries - Sets the max amount of retries for generating batches. Helps to reduce cpu usage / battery draining.

    • Method Detail

      • getEndpoint

        public java.lang.String getEndpoint(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Retrieves the URL of the backend to send batches to.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - String value of the URL to the backend

      • setEndpoint

        public void setEndpoint(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Changes the URL of the backend to send batches to.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - String value of the URL to the backend

      • setMaxRetries

        public void setMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Changes the number of times the SDK should try to resend data to the backend before giving up.
        Parameters:
        maxRetries - number of times to retry

      • setO2MCExceptionListener

        public void setO2MCExceptionListener(O2MCExceptionListener o2MCExceptionListener)
        Sets an exception listener which receives any exceptions thrown by the O2MC module.
        Parameters:
        o2MCExceptionListener - any class implementing the `O2MCExceptionListener` interface

      • setIdentifier

        public void setIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
        Sets an identifier for a user. This identifier will be sent along with tracked events. This could be useful to correlate various batches with each other.
        Parameters:
        identifier - any identifier you'd like to use to identify a user with (in String format)

      • setSessionIdentifier

        public void setSessionIdentifier()
        Sets a randomly generated UUID for a user. This identifier will be sent along with tracked events. This could be useful to correlate various batches with each other.

      • setLogging

        public void setLogging(boolean shouldLog)
        Enable or disable logging. Logging in release builds is disabled. This behavior is immutable. Logging in all other builds is configurable. The default is set to 'true', logging is enabled.
        Parameters:
        shouldLog - true if logging should be enabled, false if logging should be disabled

      • track

        public void track(java.lang.String eventName)
        Tracks an event. Essentially adds a new event with the String parameter as name to be dispatched on the next dispatch interval.
        Parameters:
        eventName - name of tracked event

      • trackWithProperties

        public void trackWithProperties(java.lang.String eventName,
                                java.lang.Object value)
        Tracks an event with additional data. Essentially adds a new event with the String parameter as name and any properties in String format. Will be dispatched to backend on next dispatch interval.
        Parameters:
        eventName - name of tracked event
        value - anything you'd like to keep track of in String format

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Removes events that were cached and would have been sent on the next interval otherwise. Additionally disallows generating new events created by the 'track' methods. Stops sending events to the backend altogether.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Allows generating new events created by the 'track' methods. Starts sending events to the backend again.
